title: Handsome serif to pair with Avant Garde?
content:
Hi

I am looking for a serif face that works with Avant Garde. Avant Garde will be used in headings, (mostly bold and in all caps) but I am looking for something a little more refined and readable as body text, as I find Avant Garde too hard to work with for this purpose. (It always ends up as a one-trick pony when I use it in body)

Any suggestions? I want something a little machined, masculine and serious as I am using it in a brochure for outdoor furniture for public places (lots of wood and steel). It also has to work well on glossy paper.

Thanks
author: Henrik Tandberg

comments.content: The obvious choice is Lubalin Graph, which is essentially the same as Avant Garde with serifs added, but it's still not great for running text. A sturdy slab serif like Clarendon might work, depending on the weight and size you use.
I might go for a slab yes, but I was thinking lighter, more delicate than both Lubalin and Clarendon
Not a slab, but how about Melior?
Melior wasn't bad. Is it well behaved on high-gloss paper?
